circumstances: After takeoff from Chicago-Midway Airport, on a cargo flight to Bloomington via Peoria, the pilot encountered a loss of power on the left engine. The pilot attempted to return for an emergency landing when the airplane entered a tight turn, lost height, struck trees and crashed in a wooded area, bursting into flames. The pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Engine failure due to valve assemblies material failure. The following contributing factors were reported:
- The pilot failed to follow approved procedures, 
- Forced landing off airport on land, 
- N°5 exhaust valve seat in left engine came out of recession, 
- Witness observed aircraft in tight turn back to airport.
